column4: How can I move a window onto my 2nd monitor in Unity? It tries to maximize when I drag to the edge of the 1st monitor.
open ccsm and disable the Grid plugin
is it possible to have the grid work but only on right monitor's right edge and left monitor's left edge?
I havent tried hold on let me check
also, what is ccsm?
compizconfig-settings-manager,, you probably will have to install it,  although no longer sure why ubuntu  doesnt include that with Unity
you can disable edge bindings in Grid  once you get compizconfi-settings-manager installed

disabled grid, but I can't drag windows to the other monitor still. My cursor can go over there when it's not holding a window, but even if I drag a window halfway off the first monitor, it doesn't show on the second
which video card are you using?
GeForce GT 220. I have the official driver installed
and do you have separate xscreens set up ?
did you use twinview with t hat?
are you using twinview?
looks like I forgot to enable xinerama :P
no no
no  it is not
open nvidia-settings
click on  "X Server Display Configuration"
are both monitors listed graphically there?
then click on the seondary monitor graphic ,, configure   twinview    set resolution
thats why you cant drag to the other monitor
I thought enabling xinerama would fix that
you have to use twinview to drag from one to the other monitor
